messages.message:
I’ve heard we’re working on “Entity Selection to create field”. That sounds like a welcome feature.
At the moment I’m struggling to extract the correct table from a set of 3 long tables on a PDF, where we seem to have created 3 Tables in the preview window. But the prompt can’t access it :grimacing: .

If someone has an idea of how to get this prompt to work, let me know
@Vishnu what do you call this feature?
maybe @Prashant Kikani or @Atinder would be able to help with the prompting to identify the correct table. @Orlando could you share a screenshot of the table you want it to pick up
i know that the project url is in the screenshot :sweat_smile: but can you also copy-paste the project link for ease of investigation?
It’s a customers ST Deployment with SSO. Will you be able to access it?
ah i saw credentials in 1password and assumed i would be able to access the environment, i forgot they already turned on SSO a while ago :facepalm:
ah I hope not! :sweat_smile:  that would have been alarming to know we hadn’t removed our access
sure i could hop on a screenshare now if that works?

to summarize our call:
• i assumed Orlando has access to the file system, but he does not since the “Customer Admin” role on ICC does not have the “Manage AI Hub” permission (which makes sense for customer admins)
• i was trying to get to the file used to store the table entities - in that file, each table entity has a generated name, and if we use that generated name in the field description, usually we get the desired table
• for now, we’ll try to re-create this document with some falsified/random data -> upload that document into a different environment -> try to extract the tables from that sample document
it’s not identical because the start of each page deosn’t restate the floor level:
btw i created a version where the start of each page restates the floor and the column headers

the good news is that we do treat each multipage table for L18 / L19 / L24 as a single table entity :tada:

the bad news is that the generated table names are not great for this sample file ^ :disappointed:
• “Access Group: L18 RenRe” -> “Active Cardholders with Expiry and Activation Dates in Renaissance Re”
• “Access Group: L19 RenRe” -> “Renaissance Re Cardholders with Expiry and Activation Dates”
• “Access Group: L24 RenRe” -> “Renaissance Re Cardholders with Expiry and Activation Dates_2"

so if i ask for “Access Group: L18 RenRe”, the model doesn’t return any table

but as expected, if i use the table name “Active Cardholders with Expiry and Activation Dates in Renaissance Re” as the field description, i get exactly the desired “Access Group: L18 RenRe” table (you can’t see in the screenshot, but the returned table looks exactly correct)
